subject: Climate & Environment
title: How Reforestation Works
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: How Reforestation Works.

hook.text: Plant a seedling. Wait 10 years. You have a tree. Wait 50 and you have a forest.

buildup.text: Reforestation means replanting trees on land that was recently deforested or degraded.

discovery.text: Native species mixtures work far better than monoculture plantations for biodiversity.

twist.text: Simply planting trees isn't enough. Without follow-up care, most seedlings die in year one.

climax.text: Successful projects involve local communities and take decades of sustained commitment.

punchline.text: A tree planted is not a forest restored. That takes patience.

quiz.question: Why do native species mixtures outperform monoculture plantations?
